intro: Achillea ageratum, commonly known as flossflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fluffy, white or pale blue flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow, gray-green, and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Achillea ageratum is often used in gardens for its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and full sun.
